text:
<@U1T13H6S3>: This is the updated code:
```mMap.setOnMarkerClickListener(new GoogleMap.OnMarkerClickListener() {
            @Override
            public boolean onMarkerClick(final Marker marker) {

                LatLng markerLocation = marker.getPosition();
                Point mappoint = mMap.getProjection().toScreenLocation(new LatLng(markerLocation.latitude, markerLocation.longitude));
                mappoint.set(mappoint.x, mappoint.y + 300);

                CameraUpdate cu = CameraUpdateFactory.newLatLng(mMap.getProjection().fromScreenLocation(mappoint));

                mMap.animateCamera(cu, new GoogleMap.CancelableCallback() {
                    @Override
                    public void onFinish() {
                        if (marker != null)
                            marker.showInfoWindow();
                    }
                    @Override
                    public void onCancel() {
                    }
                });

                return false;
            }
        });``` I use your code as a point where to call my code. But it’s the same
because CameraUpdate cu = CameraUpdateFactory.newLatLngZoom(new LatLng(latitude, longitude), zoom); will center the marker, not the info window
can you share a screen shot of your info window
info window pointed to marker right? if your marker is in center the info window appears in the position where your marker located, right?

text: <@U0Z248CVB>: the window does seem to be centred on the screen but not on the view. I assume that offsetting the centring vertically by the size of the toolbar would fix the issue
<@U09T8SFG8>: I am not sure I understand you clearly. Which view should I center minus the toolbar height?
<@U0Z248CVB>: sorry I was wrong because I misunderstood your question
Aki, Bro, you push me on right way!  I make it this way  String str = String.valueOf(data.get(itemPosition).get(ATTRIBUTE_ENG_TRANSLATE));  Very thank you!
I think I should move the camera up, but maybe I am not doing it in the right place because nothing happens.
<@U1T13H6S3>: The link you gave is for setting custom width. That’s not what I want. I want the info window (or actually the camera) to be moved by y so the whole info window is visible
I did it. The problem was “returning false;” should be true

Any reason I shouldn’t use TabLayout for bottom navigation?
Much easier to just disable swipe to change tab than write your own ViewPager system.
Perhaps, I haven't really looked at bottom navigation
Well I didn't really offer any help :stuck_out_tongue:
most current solutions are hacky at best
we use AHBottomNavigation at work, and I use BottomBar for a side project
Yeah, they al felt very hacky.
I think I’m just going to give TabLayout a try. I don’t see a reason why that wouldn’t do the job.
TabLayout with a custom viewpager that is.
